Description: PROJECT TITLE:  PROPOSAL TO EXPAND WATER-LEVEL MONITORING NETWORK WITHIN PRESIDIO COUNTY IN FAR WEST TEXASPROJECT PERIOD:  7 15 2023 THROUGH 7 14 2025THE PRESIDIO COUNTY UNDERGROUND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT (PCUWCD) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT THE PCUWCD WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR TWO YEARS TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO PURCHASE AND INSTALL PRESSURE TRANSDUCERS IN 14 WELLS TO PROVIDE CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL DATA. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE PCUWCD WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) SERVE THE DATA FROM THE NEWLY INSTALLED PRESSURE TRANSDUCERS TO THE NGWMN, AND 5) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: PRESIDIO COUNTY UNDERGROUND WATER CONSERVATION DISTRICT, WATER USERS WITHIN PRESIDIO COUNTY AND SURROUNDING AREAS, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

PROJECT TITLE:  OREGON WATER RESOURCES DEPARTMENT: MAINTENANCE FUNDING FOR EXISTING NGWMN DATA PROVIDERPROJECT PERIOD:  7 15 2023 THROUGH 7 14 2025THE OREGON WATER RESOURCES DEPARTMENT (ORWRD) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE ORWRD WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: OREGON WATER RESOURCES DEPARTMENT, WATER USERS WITHIN OREGON, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

PROJECT TITLE:  OBSERVATION WELL INTEGRITY TESTING AND GEOPHYSICAL SURVEYPROJECT PERIOD:  07 01 2023 THROUGH 06 30 2024THE OHIO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (OHDNR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN). DURING THIS PROJECT, THE OHDNR WILL DO SITE INFORMATION GAP FILLING AT 17 WELLS AND PERFORM WELL-INTEGRITY TESTING AT 25 WELLS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE OHDNR WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) ADD DATA COLLECTED DURING GAP FILLING AND WELL MAINTENANCE WORK TO THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY, AND 3) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: OHIO DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES, WATER USERS WITHIN OHIO, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

PROJECT TITLE: 2023-2025 NETWORK MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENTS IN SUPPORT OF THE NGWMNPROJECT PERIOD:  9 1 2023 THROUGH 8 31 2025THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (NCDEQ) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT THE NCDEQ WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR TWO YEARS TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO MAINTAIN, EXPAND, AND IMPROVE WATER-QUALITY WEB SERVICES AND WILL REPLACE 185 DATA LOGGERS THAT ARE OVER 5-YEARS OLD. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE NCDEQ WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY, WATER USERS WITHIN NORTH CAROLINA, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY NCDEQ STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WORK TO MAINTAIN AND UPDATE WEB SERVICES WILL BE PERFORMED BY A CONTRACT VENDOR.

PROJECT TITLE: NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES GROUNDWATER LEVEL MONITORING 2023PROJECT PERIOD: 9 15 2023 THROUGH 9 14 2024THE NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES (NMBGMR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT THE NMBGMR WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR ONE YEAR TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO PERFORM BOREHOLE CAMERA LOGGING AT FOUR WELLS TO DO SITE INFORMATION GAP FILLING. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE NMBGMR WILL: 1) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 2) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 3) UPDATE THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY WITH DATA COLLECTED DURING BOREHOLE CAMERA LOGGING, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES, WATER USERS WITHIN NEW MEXICO, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

PROJECT TITLE:  NEW HAMPSHIRE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK PROPOSALPROJECT PERIOD: 7 1 2023 THROUGH 6 30 2025THE NEW HAMPSHIRE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (NHGS) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN). DURING THIS PROJECT THE NHGS WILL PERFORM VIDEO LOGGING AT TWO WELLS, REPLACE DAMAGED CASING AT ONE WELL, REPLACE THE WELL COVER ON ONE WELL, AND PUMP TEN WELLS. THEY WILL ALSO DRILL TWO WELLS AND EQUIP THEM WITH CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL MONITORING EQUIPMENT.  AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE NHGS WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) UPDATE THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY, 3) ADD THE NEWLY DRILLED WELLS TO THE NGWMN AND BEGIN SERVING CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL DATA TO THE NGWMN, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: NEW HAMPSHIRE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, WATER USERS WITHIN NEW HAMPSHIRE, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE UNLCSD WILL: 1) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 2) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 3) UPDATE THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY AFTER BOREHOLE LOGGING, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: CONSERVATION   SURVEY DIVISION, WATER USERS WITHIN NEBRASKA, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

THEY WILL ALSO DRILL THREE NEW WELLS TO FILL GAPS IN THE NGWMN AND REPLACE OR UPGRADE PRESSURE TRANSDUCERS AT 15 WELLS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE MBMG WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) ADD THE NEWLY DRILLED WELLS TO THE NGWMN, AND 5) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. WORK TO DRILL THE NEW WELLS WILL BE CONTRACTED TO A LICENSED WATER WELL CONTRACTOR.

USGS NGWMN:  PROPOSAL FOR THE OFFICE OF LAND AND WATER RESOURCES, A DIVISION OF MSDEQ FY2023PROJECT PERIOD:  8 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2025THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (MSDEQ) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THEY WILL ALSO INSTALL CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL MONITORING EQUIPMENT ON 38 WELLS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE MSDEQ WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) SERVE CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL DATA FOR 38 NEW WELLS, AND 5) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. PROJECT TITLE:  ESTABLISHING MICHIGAN AS A NEW DATA PROVIDER TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORKPROJECT PERIOD:  7 15 2023 THROUGH 7 14 2025THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY (MIEGLE) IS UNDERTAKING THIS PROJECT TO BECOME A NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) DATA PROVIDER. THEY WILL SELECT SITES AND SET UP WEB SERVICES TO BECOME A WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER TO THE NGWMN. IN THE SECOND YEAR OF THE PROJECT, THEY WILL SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND ENHANCE THE NGWMN BY FILLING SITE INFORMATION DATA GAPS.DURING THIS PROJECT THE MIEGLE WILL SET UP WEB SERVICES IN ORDER TO SERVE THEIR DATA TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL. THEY WILL DEVELOP SITE SELECTION AND CLASSIFICATION CRITERIA FOR CANDIDATE SITES AND THEN USE THESE CRITERIA TO SELECT AND CLASSIFY SITES FOR THE NGWMN. THEY WILL ADD METADATA FOR THE NEW SITES TO THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY. DURING THE SECOND YEAR OF THE PROJECT THE MIEGLE WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES TO ENSURE THAT DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE AND WILL GPS SITE LOCATIONS TO FILL NGWMN SITE INFORMATION DATA GAPS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE MIEGLE WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) POPULATE THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY WILL SELECTED SITES, 3) SET UP WEB SERVICES TO DELIVER DATA TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL, 3) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 4) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 5) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT, GREAT LAKES, AND ENERGY, WATER USERS WITHIN MICHIGAN, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

PROJECT TITLE: PETERSBURG WELL INTERFERENCE AREAPROJECT PERIOD:  8 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2024THE LOWER LOUP NATURAL RESOURCES DISTRICT (LLNRD) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN). DURING THIS PROJECT THE LLNRD WILL DRILL THREE MONITORING WELLS AT TWO LOCATIONS TO FILL GAPS IN THE NGWMN. THEY WILL ALSO EQUIP THE NEW WELLS WITH PRESSURE TRANSDUCERS. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE LLNRD WILL: 1) ADD THE NEWLY DRILLED WELLS TO THE NGWMN AND BEGIN SERVING CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL DATA FOR THE WELLS TO THE NGWMN, AND 2) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: LOWER LOUP NATURAL RESOURCES DISTRICT, WATER USERS WITHIN CONSERVATION DISTRICT, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY LLNRD STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WORK TO DRILL THE NEW WELLS WILL BE CONTRACTED TO A LICENSED WATER WELL CONTRACTOR.

PROJECT TITLE:  IOWA GS FY2023 NGWMN PROJECTPROJECT PERIOD:  8 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2025THE IOWA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (IAGS) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT THE IAGS WILL REVISE WATER-LEVEL WEB SERVICES UNDER OBJECTIVE 2B, PUMP NINE WELLS AND MODIFY AN EXISTING WELL, DRILL THREE NEW WELLS, AND EQUIP THE THREE NEW WELLS AND THE MODIFIED WELL UNDER WITH CONTINUOUS WATER LEVEL MONITORING. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE IAGS WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) UPGRADE WATER-LEVEL DATA WEB SERVICES, 5) PROVIDE DATA FROM THREE NEWLY DRILLED WELLS AND A MODIFIED EXISTING WELL, AND 6) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: IOWA GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, WATER USERS WITHIN IOWA, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY IAGS STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WORK TO MODIFY THE EXISTING WELL AND DRILL THREE NEW WELLS WILL BE CONTRACTED TO A LICENSED WATER WELL CONTRACTOR.

PROJECT TITLE:  EXPANSION OF DATA PROVIDED TO THE NGWMN IN GRAND COUNTY, UTPROJECT PERIOD:  8 1 2023 THROUGH 7 31 2024                      THE GRAND COUNTY UTAH (GCU) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. PROJECT TITLE: DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK 2023 PROJECT PERIOD: 07 01 2023 THROUGH 06 30 2025THE DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (DGS) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE FLOW OF THE DISTRICTS DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT THE DGS WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR TWO YEARS TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL DO WELL MAINTENANCE INCLUDING BOREHOLE VIDEO CAMERA INSPECTIONS, SLUG TESTING, AND MONITORING WELL PUMPING AT 19 WELLS. THEY WILL ALSO UPGRADE SIX SITES WHICH ARE CURRENTLY MEASURED QUARTERLY TO CONTINUOUS MONITORING. AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE DGS WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) ENSURE THAT DATA COLLECTED UNDER OBJECTIVE 4 IS UPDATED IN THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY AND AGENCY DATABASES, 5) PROVIDE DATA FROM NEWLY UPGRADED CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL SITES TO THE NGWMN, AND 6) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: DELAWARE GEOLOGICAL SURVEY, WATER USERS WITHIN DELAWARE, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

COLORADO DIVISION OF WATER RESOURCESCOLORADO DIVISION OF WATER RESOURCES: ADD SITES FROM THE LOWER SOUTH PLATTE RIVER BASIN ALLUVIAL AQUIFERPROJECT PERIOD 7/15/2022 THROUGH 6/30/2023THE COLORADO DIVISION OF WATER RESOURCES (CODWR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICT'S DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ADD SITES TO THE NGWMN.DURING THIS PROJECT THE CODWR WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR ONE YEAR TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT THE METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO EVALUATE 142 POTENTIAL SITES FROM THE SOUTH PLATTE ALLUVIAL AQUIFER FOR INCLUSION IN THE NGWMN. SELECTED SITES WILL BE ADDED TO THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY. THE FUNDING FOR THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT IS $20,110.23.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE CODWR WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 4) ADD NEW SOUTH PLATTE ALLUVIAL AQUIFER SITES TO THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY, AND 5) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: CODWR, WATER USERS WITHIN EASTERN COLORADO, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

INDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEYINDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY'S EXPANSION AND IMPROVEMENT TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORKPROJECT PERIOD 9/1/2022 THROUGH 8/31/2024THE INDIANA GEOLOGICAL AND WATER SURVEY (INGWS) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCESUSGS NATIONAL GROUNDWATER MONITORING NETWORKPROJECT PERIOD 7/15/2022 THROUGH 7/14/2023THE MISSOURI DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (MODNR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT THE FLOW OF THE DISTRICT'S DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN.DURING THIS PROJECT THE MODNR WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR ONE YEAR TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT THE METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO ADD 13 NEW WELLS TO THE NGWMN. THEY WILL REVIEW EXISTING DATA TO FILL DATA GAPS AT 81 WELLS, PERFORM DOWNHOLE VIDEO INSPECTIONS AT 16 WELLS, AND WILL DO WELL-INTEGRITY TESTING AT FOUR WELLS. THE FUNDING FOR THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT IS $100,047.00.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE MODNR WILL: 1) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 2) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, 3) MAKE ANY REQUIRED UPDATES TO THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY FROM INFORMATION OBTAINED THROUGH THE GAP FILLING AND BOREHOLE CAMERA WORK, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: MODNR, WATER USERS IN MISSOURI, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY MODNR STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WELL INTEGRITY TESTING WILL BE DONE BY A LICENSED WATER WELL CONTRACTOR.

SUWANNEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT, FLORIDASUWANNEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES, WELL DRILLING, AND WELL REHABILITATION PROPOSAL TO NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORKPROJECT PERIOD 7/15/2022 THROUGH 7/14/2024THE SUWANNEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT (SRWMD) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICT'S DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN.DURING THIS PROJECT THEY WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR TWO YEARS TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT THE METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO REHABILITATE TWO WELLS AS PART OF WELL MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES. WORK ON THESE WELLS WILL INVOLVE REPLACING SURFACE CASING AND THE EXISTING CONCRETE PADS AND DOING WELL REDEVELOPMENT WORK ON THE WELLS. THEY WILL DRILL A NEW MONITORING WELL FOR THE NGWMN INTO THE UPPER FLORIDAN AQUIFER TO FILL A GAP IN THE NETWORK. THEY WILL ALSO COLLECT RELEVANT METADATA ON THE NEW WELL AND PROVIDE THIS DATA THROUGH THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY. THEY WILL EQUIP THE WELL WITH WATER-LEVEL MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND WILL INITIATE SHARING OF DATA FROM THIS WELL THROUGH THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL. THE FUNDING FOR THE TWO-YEAR PROJECT IS $68,532.50.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE SRWMD WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: SUWANNEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT, THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION, WATER USERS WITHIN THE SUWANNEE RIVER WATER MANAGEMENT DISTRICT BOUNDARIES, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY SRWMD STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WORK TO PERFORM WELL REHABILITATION WORK AT THE TWO SITES AND DRILLING OF THE UPPER FLORIDAN WELL WILL BE CONTRACTED TO A STATE OF FLORIDA LICENSED WATER WELL CONTRACTOR.

GRAND COUNTY, UTAHDATA PROVIDER PROPOSAL FOR SPANISH VALLEY AND GRAND COUNTY, UTPROJECT PERIOD 7/15/2022 THROUGH 7/14/2023GRAND COUNTY UTAH IS UNDERTAKING THIS PROJECT TO BECOME A NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) DATA PROVIDER. GRAND COUNTY WILL COORDINATE WITH PARTNER AGENCIES TO SELECT SITES IN THE SPANISH VALLEY. THEY WILL SELECT SITES AND SET UP WEB SERVICES TO BECOME A WATER-LEVEL AND WATER-QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER TO THE NGWMN. DURING THIS PROJECT, GRAND COUNTY WILL DEVELOP SITE SELECTION AND CLASSIFICATION CRITERIA FOR CANDIDATE SITES AND THEN USE THESE CRITERIA TO SELECT AND CLASSIFY SITES FOR THE NGWMN. THEY WILL ADD METADATA FOR THE NEW SITES TO THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY. THEY WILL COORDINATE WITH THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY TO PROVIDE THE DATA TO THE NGWMN THROUGH THEIR EXISTING WEB SERVICES. THE FUNDING FOR THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT IS $41,980.03.AS PART OF THE PROJECT, GRAND COUNTY WILL: 1) POPULATE THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY WILL SELECTED SITES, 2) PROVIDE DATA TO THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY SO THAT DATA CAN BE SERVED TO THE NGWMN, AND 3) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE: GRAND COUNTY, THE STATE OF UTAH, THE MOAB AREA WATERSHED PARTNERSHIP, SAN JUAN SPANISH VALLEY SPECIAL SERVICE DISTRICT, THE TOWN OF CASTLE VALLEY, WATER USERS WITHIN THE SPANISH VALLEY, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.IN ADDITION TO WORK PERFORMED BY GROUND COUNTY STAFF, SOME OF THE PROJECT FUNDS ARE FOR SUBRECIPIENTS. WORK TO ADD SITES TO THE MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY AND SERVE THE DATA TO THE NGWMN WILL BE CONTRACTED TO THE UTAH GEOLOGICAL SURVEY.

NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCESNEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES GROUNDWATER LEVEL MONITORING PROJECT PERIOD 9/15/2022 THROUGH 9/14/2023THE NEW MEXICO BUREAU OF GEOLOGY AND MINERAL RESOURCES (NMBGMR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICT'S DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN).DURING THIS PROJECT THE NMBGMR WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR ONE YEAR TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT THE METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THE FUNDING FOR THE ONE-YEAR PROJECT IS $21,532.99.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE NMBGMR WILL: 1) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 2) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 3) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: NMBGMR, WATER USERS IN NEW MEXICO, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

TEXAS WATER DEVELOPMENT BOARD TEXAS WATER DEVELOPMENT BOARD SUPPORT OF PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES AND EQUIPMENT UPGRADES FOR THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORKPROJECT PERIOD 9/1/2022 THROUGH 8/31/2024THE TEXAS WATER DEVELOPMENT BOARD (TWDB) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL AND WATER QUALITY NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT FLOW OF THE DISTRICT'S DATA TO THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN) AND TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NGWMN.DURING THIS PROJECT THE TWDB WILL PROVIDE PERSISTENT DATA SERVICES FOR TWO YEARS TO ENSURE THAT THEIR DATA CONTINUES TO FLOW TO THE NGWMN DATA PORTAL AND THAT THE METADATA FOR NETWORK SITES ARE UP TO DATE. THEY WILL ALSO REPLACE CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT 28 WELLS. THE FUNDING FOR THE TWO-YEAR PROJECT IS $130,640.90.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE TWDB WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK, 2) KEEP THE NGWMN MONITORING LOCATION REGISTRY UP TO DATE WITH LATEST SITE METADATA, 3) ENSURE THAT WEB SERVICES FOR THE NGWMN CONTINUE TO DELIVER DATA TO THE DATA PORTAL, AND 4) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: TWDB, WATER USERS WITHIN TEXAS, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.

MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCESMINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES GROUNDWATER LEVEL MONITORING NETWORK ENHANCEMENT TO TELEMETRIC DATA TRANSFERPROJECT PERIOD 7/15/2022 THROUGH 6/30/2024THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (MNDNR) IS A CURRENT WATER-LEVEL NETWORK DATA PROVIDER. THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE DATA COLLECTED BY THE PROVIDER FOR THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK (NGWMN).DURING THIS PROJECT THE MNDNR WILL REPLACE CONTINUOUS WATER-LEVEL MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT 26 WELLS. THE FUNDING FOR THE TWO-YEAR PROJECT IS $68,673.00.AS PART OF THE PROJECT THE MNDNR WILL: 1) DELIVER A PROJECT STATUS REPORT AFTER ONE YEAR OF WORK AND 2) PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT DOCUMENTING ALL WORK ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE PROJECT.THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE WORK WILL BE THE: MNDNR, WATER USERS IN MINNESOTA, AND USERS OF THE NATIONAL GROUND-WATER MONITORING NETWORK.
